body:
The old way ends up never setting the names for any tensors - TRT initializes tensor names to "(Unnamed ITensor* N)" so the condition `(tensor_name == nullptr || std::strlen(tensor_name) == 0)` can never be met.

We now rely on the tensor names for reporting which tensors are missing quantization ranges.
body_html:
The old way ends up never setting the names for any tensors - TRT initializes tensor names to "(Unnamed ITensor* N)" so the condition (tensor_name == nullptr || std::strlen(tensor_name) == 0) can never be met.

We now rely on the tensor names for reporting which tensors are missing quantization ranges.
body_text:
The old way ends up never setting the names for any tensors - TRT initializes tensor names to "(Unnamed ITensor* N)" so the condition (tensor_name == nullptr || std::strlen(tensor_name) == 0) can never be met.
We now rely on the tensor names for reporting which tensors are missing quantization ranges.
